bug.author: techthiyanes
bug.description:
While using the below code: <denchmark-code>import numpy as np import pandas as pd import pandas_profiling
from pandas_profiling import ProfileReport
# The dataframe is the same as the tutorial example given by the author. # No dataframes work with the df.profile_report() method.
df = pd.DataFrame( np.random.rand(100, 5), columns=['a', 'b', 'c', 'd', 'e'] )
ProfileReport(df) # this works, but `df.profile_report()` does not work </denchmark-code>
The below error message i am getting.
TypeError: describe() missing 1 required positional argument: 'df'
Is this issue causing due to new version? I have been using 2.7.0 and updated the pandas_profiling version recently.

comments.comment:
Could you provide the minimal information about your environment to reproduce this error?
which environment you are using:
operating system (e.g. Windows, Linux, Mac) Python version (e.g. 3.7) jupyter notebook, console or IDE such as PyCharm Package manager (e.g. pip, conda conda info) packages (pip freeze > packages.txt or conda list)

Thanks. At glance it seems that you're up-to-date. I could not reproduce the issue with a similar environment. The only way I could get a similar error is by not initializing the DataFrame: Could you try pip uninstall pandas-profiling, then pip install pandas-profiling and restarting the kernel? Alternatively, you could try a new virtual environment.

Thanks for the comments on fixing it. After creating the virtual env, it is working fine. But while trying to create the report from excel file, i am getting the error as KeyError: 'script_values'. Able to create the report where minimal=True.

Thanks for the comments on fixing it. After creating the virtual env, it is working fine. But while trying to create the report from excel file, i am getting the error as KeyError: 'script_values'. Able to create the report where minimal=True.
I've released a fix. Please update to v2.7.1 to resolve the issue.
